comments:
I get the following exception in the latest build. I think it is because of an isLocal check I removed recently.

Created an attachment (id=59380)
Image of the dialog

The dialog appeared many many times while I imported the all plug-ins that are in my workspace as binary plug-ins.

Created an attachment (id=59381)
Another variant of the dialog
After that the Sync view gets reset.

Created an attachment (id=59382)
Patch that reverts back to using the deprecated
The attached jar can just be dropped into the plugins directory of your install (i.e. the version number is property set to override the version in the build)

Removing the isLocal check should not have had this effect since the IResource API no longer supports non-local resources. It would appear that there is either a brief period of time for which a resource that exists isn't local or that the java builder is, for some reason, creating non-local resources. In either case,w e need to investigate why this is happening. We also need to protect the CVS code from failing.
I have logged bugs 174808 and bug 174811 on issues related to this bug.
I think we need to keep the CVS code as it is since, even if the race condition in Resources gets fixed, there is always a chance that non-local resources get created.
